title: Fabian Moreau active, to make season debut for Redskins vs. Bears
text:
LANDOVER — The Washington Redskins’ secondary isn’t fully healthy, but they will be getting some much needed help Monday when cornerback Fabian Moreau will make his season debut against the Chicago Bears.

Moreau had missed the first two games of the year with an ankle injury.

Normally the team’s slot corner, Moreau will start opposite Josh Norman as Quinton Dunbar (knee) is out again.

Dunbar was among the Redskins’ group of inactives as tight end Jordan Reed (concussion), quarterback Colt McCoy (leg), outside linebacker Cassanova McKinzy (hip), guard Wes Martin, center Ross Pierschbacher and defensive lineman T.Y. McGill.

Defensive end Jonathan Allen will also play after missing last week with a knee sprain.
